Missoula Business and Professional Women Records

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Kellyn Younggren 2014

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Missoula Business and Professional Women records
did.abstract: The Missoula Business and Professional Women is an organization in Missoula, Montana that promotes equal rights for women in the workplace. This collection primarily consists of reports, minutes, and correspondence generated by the operation of the organization and programs from the annual state conventions.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The National Federation of Business and Professional Women’s Clubs organized in 1919 for the purpose of unifying American working women and providing them a means to work toward equality in their professions. In the state of Montana, Missoula was the first city to initiate any local activity and organized a state meeting in March 1921. Missoula resident Lillian Payne acted as the organizer and chair of the first meeting. The state held its first convention in Missoula in 1922 and the city was well represented with residents Amelia Loffnes elected Director, Mabel Humphrey Treasurer, and Elizabeth Powell National Vice President.

Missoula’s organization held a prominent place in the state club, with members repeatedly serving as directors and state officers. The Missoula chapter actively participated in state club activities including: the Young Career Woman contest that recognized young, female professionals; the Woman of Achievement/Woman of the Year Award; and numerous scholarship programs. In more recent years, Missoula members have been crucially active in the Silent Witness Initiative in Montana a project devoted to raising awareness about domestic violence. The club continued in its tradition of serving Missoula women through disseminating information, informed advocacy, and educating the public on issues pertaining to women’s rights.

scopecontent.p: This collection is primarily materials related to the operation and maintenance of the Missoula Business and Professional Women organization including meeting minutes, correspondence, reports, clippings, financial information, membership lists, photographs, applications, scholarship information, constitutions, yearbooks, and scrapbook pages. There is also material pertaining to the Montana Federation of Business and Professional Women’s Clubs including annual convention programs, emblem ceremony programs, and pamphlets. It also contains programs and reports on the meetings of the National Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs as well as publications and mailings from the organization. There are also materials relating to the International Federation of Business and Professional Women’s Clubs including publications and pamphlets.

arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into four series with folders arranged chronologically or alphabetically.
Series I: Missoula Business and Professional Women and Other Montana Chapters, 1920-1996
Series II: National and International Business and Professional Women’s Clubs, 1923-1983 and undated
Series III: Photographs and Negatives, 1935-1957 and undated

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Non-exclusive copyright transferred to The University of Montana--Missoula.

prefercite.p: Missoula Business and Professional Women Records, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: This collection was donated by Vickie Amundson on May 13, 2004.

processinfo.p: The original order was maintained wherever possible, previously foldered items retain their original titles. During processing, duplicates were removed from the collection along with materials not relating to the club. The 1920 Certificate of Membership in the national federation was donated and added to this collection in 2020.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
